pygeotoolbox.database.base module¶

class pygeotoolbox.database.base.DatabaseTemplate[source]¶

Template for geodatabase class. Methods with NotImplementedError must be implemented by all descendants.

cleanTableContent(tableName, schema='temp', whereClause='')[source]¶
clearBuffer(buffer)[source]¶

Executes all commands in a buffer, commits the database and returns empty buffer.

Parameters:of string buffer (list) – List of SQL commands.
Returns:empty buffer.

Parameters:databaseName –
Returns:
createOrCleanTable(schema, tableName, createSQL)[source]¶
createSchema(schema, dropIfExists=False)[source]¶

Creates database schema with given name.

Parameters:
  • schema (str) – schema name
  • dropIfExists (bool) – drops schema before creating, if already exists.
databaseExists(databaseName)[source]¶

Returns True if a database with name databaseName exists.

:param str databaseName:database name :return:

disconnect()[source]¶

Disconnects database connection.

execute(sql, parameters={})[source]¶

Executes sql command. Before execution, it replaces parameters if provided.

Parameters:
  • sql (str) – Command sequence to be executed;
  • parameters (dict) – Parameters to be used in a query.
executeBuffer(sql, buffer, limit=1000, parameters=None)[source]¶

Inserts sql into buffer, then executes it, if number of commands in it is higher than limit or does nothing. returns either empty or original buffer.

:param str sql:sql command to be inserted to buffer :param list of str buffer: buffer of SQL commands :param int limit: maximum number of items in a buffer before being executed :return list of str: empty list or buffer

executeSQLFile(fileName, parameters={})[source]¶

Loads SQL script from the file, compiles parameters into it and executes it.

Parameters:
  • fileName (str) – file name to be loaded as SQL script
  • parameters – paramaters to be compiled
executeSelectSQL(sql, parameters={})[source]¶

Runs SQL query and returns database cursor with query result.

Parameters:
  • sql (str) – Query to be executed.
  • parameters (dict) – Parameters to be used in a query.

:return cursor : Cursor with result or None if fails.

flushBuffer(buffer)[source]¶

clearBuffer method alias. Executes all commands in a buffer, commits the database and returns empty buffer.

Parameters:of string buffer (list) – List of SQL commands.
Returns:empty buffer.
getTableNames(schema)[source]¶

Return table names in a given database schema.

Parameters:schema (str) – schema name
Return list of str:
 list of table names
loadAndExecute(fileName, params={})[source]¶

Loads SQL script from the file and executes it.

Parameters:fileName (str) – file name to be loaded as SQL script
mute()[source]¶

Switch database into muted state, in which neither execute or executeSelectSQL commands are not commited.

muted¶

Returns True if database is muted.

tableExists(schema, tableName)[source]¶

Returns True if table exists in given schema.

Parameters:
  • schema (str) – Schema name.
  • tableName (str) – Table name.
Return bool:

True if table schema.tableName exists.
unMute()[source]¶

Switch database into unmuted state, in which both execute or executeSelectSQL commands works.

Returns table row count.

Parameters:tableFullName (String) –
Return LongInt:Row count for the table specified. 
>>> connection = Database()
>>> connection.getRowCount("public.z_terennirelief_l")
1099736L

pygeotoolbox.database.databaseByName(name)[source]¶

Returns database with a given name. If it doesn’t exist yet, creates and returns new instance.

Parameters:name (str) – database name
Returns:database with a given name
